page.title: 15CHANGING PATTERNS IN FARMING
page.content: Problems of Hop Farming (based on a local survey) Until the mid-1970's hop farming was a very prosperous activity and within Kent was valued at over 5 million pounds.Recently however,farmers have been unable to dispose of their surplus hops because of changes in the pattern of supply and demand.Local farmers are finding stiff competition from Belgian and German growers.Particularly crippling is the ability of the U.S.A. to overcome tariff barriers.A further trend is the reduction in the small users of hops as they are taken over by large multiples.Furthermore there is a general move from beer to lager drinking which reduces the demand for hops by up to 50%.
